column3: retail) with EGP original values and USD conversion

column1: # LOGIC: Prices derived from export price trends
column3: and retail markup ratios. Farmgate = ~50-60% of wholesale; Retail = ~150-200% of wholesale. Seasonal averages used for annual data.

column1: # DEPENDENCIES: USD/EGP exchange rates from World Bank and xe.com historical data
# ASSUMPTIONS: Egypt is major tomato producer (7.8 Tg annually). Price volatility reflects seasonal harvests (Mar-May
column2: Sep-Nov low prices). 2022-2024 prices affected by EGP devaluation and inflation.

column1: # DATA_QUALITY: Medium-High. Export prices from SelinaWamucii (2017-2024) well-documented. Wholesale prices from Tridge verified against CAPMAS. Earlier years (2015-2016) extrapolated from trends.

# COMPARISON_TO_TOY: Research prices show higher volatility and clearer currency effects. Toy data range $0.63-$1.20/kg wholesale; research range $0.35-$0.95/kg wholesale reflecting actual Egyptian market (lower than global average). Post-2022 EGP prices much higher due to devaluation.

column8: Pre-devaluation stable period; low domestic prices
COVID supply disruption; export price $1.39/kg peak
Major devaluation; EGP prices surge; wholesale 5-8 EGP/kg reported
